supporting_text: The NAP adopts a One Health approach by integrating human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP outlines specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP includes actions focused on animal health, particularly in the context of veterinary practices.
The NAP addresses environmental factors contributing to AMR and outlines relevant strategies.
The NAP includes specific actions related to agriculture and food security in the context of AMR.
The NAP specifies mechanisms for regular progress reporting to monitor the implementation of its objectives.
The NAP sets specific, time-bound targets for various actions to track progress effectively.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for various strategies aimed at combating AMR.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for its proposed activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral committee to coordinate AMR efforts across sectors.
The NAP includes actions aimed at strengthening the legislative framework for AMR.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR in various training programs.
The NAP includes strategies for public awareness campaigns to engage communities in combating AMR.
The NAP emphasizes international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes strategies for enhancing data collection and analysis for AMR surveillance.
The NAP outlines actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP includes specific strategies for sanitation and infection prevention and control.
The NAP includes actions to implement international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes strategies for regulating antibiotic distribution and prescription.
The NAP includes regulations aimed at promoting the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes actions to engage in international collaborative research for new AMR solutions.
